title: Rab and His Friends and Other Papers
author: Brown, John
snippet: The last time I saw him he was in absolute     beggary, and had behaved himself so ill at my uncle's     (Thomas Scott of Monklaw) house, that the old gentleman,     himself a most admirable piper, would not on any account     give him quarters, though I interceded earnestly for him,     "the knave," as Davie tells Justice Shallow, "being my very     good friend."

title: Horae subsecivae.
